alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 8:57AM CDT until May 17 at 4:39PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins threatening livestock and property in the river channel. The right approach to the County Road 401 bridge is closed making travel difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 26.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 26.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 8.8 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.2 feet on 04/19/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 26.2 Tue 8 am CDT 23.1 12.2 9.8 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
